content: शक्तिः {%<ab>f.</ab>%} [शक्-क्तिन्] {@--1@} ({%a%}) Power, ability, capacity, strength, energy, prowess; दैवं निहत्य कुरु पौरुषमात्मशक्त्या <ls>Pt. 1. 361</ls>; ज्ञानि मौनं क्षमा शक्तौ <ls>R. 1. 22</ls>; so यथाशक्ति, स्वशक्ति &c. ({%b%}) Faculty, capacity; स्मरणशक्ति ‘retentive faculty or memory’. {@--2@} Regal power; (it has three parts or elements; प्रभुशक्ति or प्रभावशक्ति ‘the majesty or pre-eminent position of the king himself’; {2} मंत्रशक्ति ‘the power of good counsel’, and {3} उत्साहशक्ति ‘the power of energy’); राज्यं नाम शक्तित्रयायत्तं <ls>Dk.</ls>; त्रिसाधना शक्तिरिवार्थसंचयं <ls>R. 3. 13</ls>, <ls n="R.">6. 33</ls>, <ls n="R.">17. 63</ls>; <ls>Śi. 2. 26.</ls> {@--3@} The power of composition, poetic power or genius; शक्तिर्निपुणता लोकशास्त्रकाव्याद्यवेक्षणात् <ls>K. P. 1</ls>; see explanation {%ad loc.%} {@--4@} The active power of a deity, regarded as his wife, female divinity; (these are variously enumerated, 8, 9 or even 50 being mentioned); स जयति परिणद्धः शक्तिभिः शक्तिनाथः <ls>Māl. 5. 1</ls>; <ls>Ś. 7. 35.</ls> {@--5@} A kind of missile; शक्तिखंडामर्षितेन गांडीविनोक्तं <ls>Ve. 3</ls>; ततो बिभेद पौलस्त्यः शक्त्या वक्षसि लक्ष्मणं <ls>R. 12. 77.</ls> {@--6@} A spear, dart, pike, lance. {@--7@} (In <ab>phil.</ab>) The relation of a term to the thing designated. {@--8@} The power inherent in cause to produce its necessary effect. {@--9@} (In <ab>Rhet.</ab>) The power or signification of a word; (these are three अभिधा, लक्षणा and व्यंजना); तिस्रः शब्दस्य शक्तयः <ls>S. D. 11.</ls> {@--10@} The expressive power or denotation of a word (<ab>opp.</ab> लक्षणा and व्यंजना); it is thus defined:-- अस्माच्छब्दादयमर्थो बोद्धव्य इत्याकारकोऽनादिसंकेतः शक्तिः <ls>Tarka K.</ls> {@--11@} The female organ, the counterpart of the Phallus of Śiva worshipped by a sect of people called Śāktas. {@--12@} A sword. {@--13@} An implement in gambling.
